data.text:
February is African Heritage Month and Black History Month, but we know research about Black history and scholarship isn’t confined to one month of the year. The SMU Library has resources to support your research on these topics year round.

The SMU Library subscribes to many journals in the subject area of African and Black history and scholarship. As a SMU student, staff or faculty member all of these resources are available to you! Not sure what a journal is? Scholarly journals publish articles that will help you with your research. Watch a SMU Library tutorial or read an overview of scholarly journal characteristics to learn more.

The Library also subscribes to databases with significant African and Black scholarship and historical content you may be interested in:

Adam Matthew Digital Collections includes the Slavery, Abolition, and Social Justice Collection, a historical primary source collection

Gale Database Selection includes Gale OneFile Diversity Studies

America History and Life has extensive coverage of Black and African American historical topics

Films on Demand collection includes thousands of videos and documentaries on Black, African American and African Canadian experience, and a collection of African Diaspora films

Sociological Abstracts

JSTOR

CBCA (Canadian Business and Current Affairs)

HOW TO FIND JOURNALS AT THE SMU LIBRARY

To find journals, visit the Library homepage and click “Journals A-Z”. Once on this page you can search for journals in multiple ways, including:

Search for journals using keywords from journal titles

In the search bar, enter keywords and phrases related to the area of study, for example: “Black”, “African”, or “African American”

Enter full titles to find known journals, for example: “African Journal of Legal Studies”

Suggested journal titles will automatically populate as you type keywords

Follow on-screen instructions to access journal articles

Browse for journals by subject area or keyword in BrowZine

Click on “New Journal Finder (BrowZine)” above the search bar

Search by keyword or subject area in BrowZine

Learn more about searching in BrowZine

Good luck with your research — you’ve got this! For help finding and using databases, journals and articles, contact the Research Help team:

Email: research@smu.ca

Phone: 902-420-5544
